metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32189 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A too-short encoded message can cause a panic in Float.GobDecode and Rat GobDecode in math/big in Go before 1.17.13 and 1.18.5, potentially allowing a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.18 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2
golang-1.18-go - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2
golang-1.18-src - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Packages built using golang need to be rebuilt once the vulnerability has been fixed. This CVE entry does not list packages that need rebuilding outside of the main repository or the Ubuntu variants with PPA overlays.

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.14 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.16 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.18 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2').
